title: Reminiscences
author: Carlyle, Thomas
snippet: The Irvings, Edward's father and uncles, lived all within a few miles of my native place, and were of my father's acquaintance. Two of the uncles, whose little farm establishments lay close upon Ecclefechan, were of his familiars, and became mine niore or less, especially one of them (George, of Bogside), who was further a coreligionist  of ours (a " Burgher Seceder," not a " Kirkman," as the other was). They were all cheerfully quiet, rational, and honest

title: Travels in lands beyond the sea.
author: Linskill, Charles Dorrance.
snippet: We pass through East Grange, Bogside, Kincardine  and Kennet, Clark-Manning, Alloa Junction and Cambus. Here is a bold, rocky mountain where the dark rocks rise almost perpendicularly five hundred feet.

title: Travels in Lands beyond the Sea. Beauty and Glory of Western Europe, etc
author: Linskill, Charles D.
snippet: We pass through East Grange, Bogside, Kincardine and Kennet, Clark-Manning, Alloa Junction andCambus. Here is a bold, rocky mountain where thedark rocks rise almost perpendicularly five hundredfeet.
